excerpt: Large, Gothic-style Catholic church built in 1929, offering masses several times a day.
detail_description: Our Lady of Dolours Basilica is a grand Gothic-style Catholic church constructed in 1929, and it hosts multiple masses daily. Located in Thrissur, Kerala, the basilica is part of a vibrant area with various attractions such as temples, waterfalls, wildlife sanctuaries, and cultural landmarks. The region also hosts the renowned Thrissur Pooram festival. Additionally, exploring nearby Fort Kochi offers a glimpse into its rich history influenced by Portuguese, Dutch, and British cultures.
name: Our Lady of Dolours Basilica
address: G6C9+C52, Erinjery Angady, Pallikkulam, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Established in 1885, this lush zoo has a range of animals & a museum on local natural history & art.
detail_description: Nestled in a lush 13.5-acre area, Thrissur Zoo & Museum is a historic establishment dating back to 1885. It features a diverse range of animals, birds, and reptiles, including endangered species. The zoo also houses an Art Museum, Botanical Garden, Natural History Museum, and Zoological Museum. Visitors can marvel at tigers, camels, hippos, flamingos, and various bird species while exploring this well-maintained space.
name: Thrissur Zoo & Museum
address: Town Hall Rd, Udaya Nagar, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

excerpt: This 18th-century Kerala-style palace features a serpent grove & a museum with sculptures & coins.
detail_description: Sakthan Thampuran Palace, an 18th-century Kerala-style architectural marvel located in the heart of Thrissur, has been transformed into a museum showcasing historical artifacts. The palace boasts a unique blend of Dutch and traditional Kerala architecture, featuring high roofs, thick walls, spacious rooms, and Italian marble flooring. Visitors can explore the serpent grove on the premises and admire the museum's collection of sculptures and coins. This cultural heritage site offers a fascinating experience for history enthusiasts.
name: Sakthan Thampuran Palace
address: Stadium Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: Vilangan kunnu is one of the important places to visit in Thrissur, Kerala.
name: Vilangan kunnu
address: Vilangan hills ticket counter, Puranattukara, Kerala 680553, India

excerpt: Imposing Hindu complex where the goddess Durga is said to have traveled on a believer's umbrella.
detail_description: Paramekkavu Bhagavathi Temple in Thrissur is a significant Hindu complex where the goddess Durga is believed to have traveled on a believer's umbrella. It is one of the largest temples dedicated to Bhagavathy in Kerala and is known for its captivating architectural design. The temple plays a crucial role in the vibrant Thrissur Pooram festival, adding to the city's festive spirit with its annual rituals and ceremonies that draw devotees and tourists alike.
name: Paramekkavu Bhagavathi Temple Thrissur
address: Paramekkavu Devaswom Building, Round East, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Ancient Shiva temple featuring legendary murals, shrines & an annual festival for devotees.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Thrissur, the Sree Vadakkumnathan Temple stands as a magnificent testament to Kerala's rich cultural heritage. This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, showcases stunning architectural features with monumental towers gracing each side and a Koothambalam that serves as a stage for traditional performances. The walls are adorned with exquisite murals that narrate tales from the Mahabharata, captivating visitors with their intricate artistry.
name: Sree Vadakkumnathan Temple
address: Swaraj Round N, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: This 8.5-acre landscaped children's park features flowers, hedges, statues & an aquarium.
detail_description: Nehru Park, also known as Heritage Garden, is an 8.5-acre landscaped park located in the heart of Thrissur. Named after India's first prime minister, it is a popular attraction for both tourists and locals. The park boasts a vast collection of ayurvedic and medicinal plants, making it a serene and educational experience. Visitors can enjoy the beauty of flowers, hedges, statues, an aquarium, and various recreational facilities for children.
name: Nehru Park, Thrissur
address: G6G8+M8Q, Swaraj Round N, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

detail_description: The Thrissur Pooram Kudamattam Ground is the vibrant setting for a colorful festival celebrated at Vadakkumnathan temple in April. The temple, located on a hillock at the city's center, draws thousands of devotees. Founded by Sakthan Thampuran, the ruler of Kochi, this festival is known as the People's Festival and is a source of pride for all Thrissur residents.
name: Thrissur Pooram Kudamattam Ground
address: G6F7+9WJ, Pradakshina Path, Kuruppam, Thekkinkadu Maidan, Thrissur, Kerala 680001, India

excerpt: Leafy hilltop park for walks, cycling & sunset views, with kids' play equipment & a snack bar.
detail_description: Vilangan Hills, also known as Vilangan Kunnu, is a picturesque hilltop park located near Trissur in Kerala. This green hillock offers stunning panoramic views of Thrissur city and the kole wetlands. Originally a common hillock, it was transformed into a scenic picnic spot under the eco-tourism scheme by the State Government of Kerala. The park features 150 mango trees and provides an enchanting allure to visitors.
name: Vilangan Hills
address: H549+XC4, Vilagan Hill Road, Thrissur, 680553, India

detail_description: The Archaeological Museum, located in the Thrissur Zoo complex, has a rich history dating back to its establishment in 1938. Originally a picture gallery, it was later converted into an archaeology museum in 1975. The museum boasts life-size statues of prominent personalities, models of ancient temples and monuments, as well as a collection of manuscripts written on dry palm leaves. Visitors can also explore artifacts from various archaeological sites including those from the Indus Valley Civilization and Harappa.
name: Archaeological Museum, Thrissur
address: G6J8+FHM, Stadium Rd, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: The Heritage Garden in Thrissur is a beloved spot in the heart of the city, attracting visitors with its well-maintained grounds and diverse flora. This tranquil oasis showcases Kerala's rich biodiversity and cultural history through its indigenous plant and animal species. It's an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts, offering a peaceful atmosphere for leisurely walks among forest and medicinal trees.
name: Heritage Garden
address: G6H8+XHF, Unnamed Road, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India

detail_description: Cheppara, located in Thrissur, is a hidden culinary gem offering a wide range of delectable dishes, from traditional Kerala delicacies to innovative fusion creations. The place features beautiful landscapes and requires climbing a hill with banister support. It's not recommended for children or the elderly, especially during the slippery monsoon season.
name: Cheppara
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Kuriachira is a municipal ward in Thrissur, Kerala. It is located within 2 km south of Swaraj Round. It lies beside the Thalore bypass road. Kuriachira is 25th division of Thrissur Municipal Corporation. It is an important residential area of Thrissur city of Kerala state of India. Wikipedia.
name: Kuriachira
address: Thrissur, Kerala, India

detail_description: Thrissur, a city in Kerala, has been facing issues with the poor condition of its buildings since the formation of the corporation in 2000. Efforts to address this have included discussions about providing concessions to construct new buildings by demolishing old ones and establishing a rehabilitation center during construction. The city's railway station is an important hub for Southern Railways, connecting it to major towns in Kerala and beyond.
name: Thrissur
address: R.S Road, Kokkala, Veliyannur, Thrissur, Kerala 68002, India

detail_description: The Appan Thampuran Memorial, also known as Ramavarma Appanthampuran Smarakam, is a cultural and literary museum located in Ayyanthole, Kerala. It is housed within the historic Kumarapuram Palace and was established in 1976 to honor the contributions of Ramavarma Appan Thampuran to literature and culture. The museum boasts an impressive collection of journals, magazines, and books that offer visitors a captivating insight into Kerala's rich cultural and literary heritage.
name: Appan Thampuran Memorial
address: Outpost Rd, Kalyan Nagar, Ayyanthole, Thrissur, Kerala 680003, India

excerpt: Compact Thekkinkadu Maidan is centered on hilltop Sri Vadakkunnathan Temple, decorated with traditional Keralan wood carvings and murals of the Hindu epic “Mahabharata.” The temple is the hub of spring’s huge Thrissur Pooram festival, which features fireworks, drumming, and a parade of costumed elephants. Nehru Park has playgrounds and an aquarium, and simple Indian restaurants are scattered throughout the area.
detail_description: The Thekkinkadu Maidan is a vibrant and lively area centered around the hilltop Sri Vadakkunnathan Temple, adorned with traditional Keralan wood carvings and murals depicting scenes from the Hindu epic “Mahabharata.” This location serves as the focal point for the grand Thrissur Pooram festival, a 36-hour-long celebration featuring over 100 elephants, accompanied by Panchavadyam music and culminating in a spectacular fireworks display.
name: Thekkinkadu Maidan
address: Kuruppam, Thrissur, Kerala, India

detail_description: The Arattupuzha Sree Sastha Temple, located in Thrissur, Kerala, is a place of great cultural and religious importance. Dedicated to Lord Ayyappa, this ancient temple has a history dating back over 3,000 years. It was originally a Dravidian temple before becoming a prominent Buddhist site and eventually transitioning into Hindu hands in the 8th century.
name: Arattupuzha Sree Sastha Temple
address: C69H+9X5, P.O. Arattupuzha, Urakam, (Dt), Kerala (State), Arattupuzha, Kerala 680562, India

excerpt: Sizable complex of stores, with a supermarket, international food court & 6-screen multiplex cinema.
detail_description: Sobha City Mall is a sprawling shopping complex located in Thrissur, Kerala. Situated along the Guruvayur Road, it has become a popular destination for locals and tourists alike. The mall boasts an extensive range of retail stores featuring both national and international brands, making it a go-to spot for all kinds of shoppers. In addition to shopping, visitors can enjoy various entertainment options such as a 6-screen multiplex cinema, restaurants, food court, and gaming arcade.
name: Sobha City Mall
address: Sobha city, Puzhakkal, Thrissur, Kerala 680553, India

excerpt: Artifacts, photos & high-tech displays exploring the history of the Ayurvedic medical system.
detail_description: Vaidyaratnam Ayurveda Museum in Kerala is a unique showcase of the history and evolution of Ayurveda, featuring artifacts, photos, and high-tech displays. The museum offers a detailed exploration of the merits and richness of Ayurvedic medicine through images, models, charts, and a panoramic exhibit tracing its history from ancient times to the modern era.
name: Vaidyaratnam Ayurveda Museum
address: Thaikkattussery Rd, opp. Vaidyaratnam Post Office, Thaikkattussery, Thrissur, Kerala 680306, India

name: Thrissur Town Hall (K. Karunakaran Memorial Town Hall)
address: Palace Rd, opposite Taluk Office, Chembukkav, Thrissur, Kerala 680020, India
